parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Timestamp used to define the start date of the time window to query

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Timestamp used to define the end date of the time window to query

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The time interval when getting histogram data (in milliseconds)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Lucene query used to filter data
parameters.x-example: api:xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx AND plan:yyyy-yyyy-yyyy-yyyy AND host:"demo.gravitee.io" AND path:/test

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The field to query when doing `group_by` queries

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of data to retrieve

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of data to retrieve

parameters.name: ranges
parameters.description: Ranges allows you to group field's data. Mainly used to group HTTP statuses code with `group_by` queries

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field used to sort results. Can be asc or desc (prefix with minus '-')

get.description: User must have the MANAGEMENT_PLATFORM[READ] permission to use this service
User must have the MANAGEMENT_PLATFORM[READ] permission to use this service

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Timestamp used to define the start date of the time window to query

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Timestamp used to define the end date of the time window to query

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The expresion used to search for logs. It looks like 'transaction:123-456-789 AND uri=\\/path\\/to\\/resource* AND response-time:[100 TO 200]'. Reserved characters that must be escaped + - = && || > < ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \ /

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of data to retrieve

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The field to query when doing `group_by` queries

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: true means ASC order, false means DESC

deploymentLabel.description: Label for an Api deployment. Duplicate names can exists.

name.description: API's name. Duplicate names can exists.

version.description: Api's version. It's a simple string only used in the portal.

description.example: I can use a hundred characters to describe this API.
description.description: API's description. A short description of your API.

groups.description: API's groups. Used to add team in your API.

visibility.description: The visibility of the API regarding the portal.

state.description: The status of the API regarding the gateway.

tags.description: the list of sharding tags associated with this API.

picture.description: the API logo encoded in base64

categories.description: the list of categories associated with this API

labels.description: the free list of labels associated with this API

background.description: the API background encoded in base64

paths.description: a map where you can associate a path to a configuration (the policies configuration)

flows.description: a list of flows (the policies configuration)

plans.description: a list of plans with flows (the policies configuration)

deployed_at.description: The last date (as timestamp) when the API was deployed.

created_at.description: The date (as a timestamp) when the API was created.

updated_at.description: The last date (as a timestamp) when the API was updated.

owner.description: The user with role PRIMARY_OWNER on this API.

properties.description: A dictionary (could be dynamic) of properties available in the API context.

services.description: The configuration of API services like the dynamic properties, the endpoint discovery or the healthcheck.

resources.description: The list of API resources used by policies like cache resources or oauth2

path_mappings.description: A list of paths used to aggregate data in analytics

response_templates.description: A map that allows you to configure the output of a request based on the event throws by the gateway. Example : Quota exceeded, api-ky is missing, ...

name.description: Api's name. Duplicate names can exists.

version.description: Api's version. It's a simple string only used in the portal.

description.description: Api's version. It's a simple string only used in the portal.

visibility.description: The visibility of the API regarding the portal.

state.description: The status of the API regarding the gateway.

categories.description: the list of categories associated with this API

labels.description: the free list of labels associated with this API

rate.description: How consumers have evaluated the API (between 0 to 5)

numberOfRatings.description: How many consumers have evaluated the API

tags.description: the list of sharding tags associated with this API.

created_at.description: The date (as a timestamp) when the API was created.

updated_at.description: The last date (as a timestamp) when the API was updated.

owner.description: The user with role PRIMARY_OWNER on this API.

healthcheck_enabled.description: true if HealthCheck is enabled globally or on one endpoint

reference.description: User's reference for user providing from an identity provider.

name.description: Application's name. Duplicate names can exists.

description.example: I can use a hundred characters to describe this App.
description.description: Application's description. A short description of your App.

domain.description: Domain used by the application, if relevant

groups.description: Application groups. Used to add teams to your application.

status.description: if the app is ACTIVE or ARCHIVED.

type.description: a string to describe the type of your app.

updated_at.description: The last date (as a timestamp) when the application was updated.
